title: Prayer for Deliverance
shortSummary: Psalm 4 is a heartfelt prayer of David calling on God for help in times of distress and injustice. It emphasizes trust in God's righteousness, the call to holiness, and the peace that comes from resting in the Lord's protection.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The psalmist and king of Israel who expresses his trust in God amidst adversity and calls for righteousness.

keyCharacters.name: Sons of men
keyCharacters.description: A term referring to David's adversaries or those who oppose him, characterized by their pursuit of vanity and falsehood.

definitions.definition: Musical instruments or stringed instruments used in temple worship, indicating the psalm is to be performed with musical accompaniment.
A liturgical or musical pause in the psalm, inviting reflection on the preceding words.
Offerings that are morally right and pleasing to God, symbolizing sincere worship and obedience.
A biblical expression meaning God's favor or approval, often associated with His presence and blessing.

outline.heading: David's Plea for Mercy and Deliverance
outline.description: David calls on God, the God of his righteousness, to hear his prayer and show mercy in his time of distress, highlighting God's past faithfulness.

outline.heading: Rebuke of the Ungodly
outline.description: David confronts those who dishonor him and pursue falsehood, affirming that God has set apart the godly and will hear their prayers.

outline.heading: Call to Holiness and Trust
outline.description: David exhorts believers to fear God, avoid sin, self-reflect in stillness, offer righteous sacrifices, and place their trust fully in the Lord.

outline.heading: Prayer for God's Favor and Joy
outline.description: David acknowledges the desire for good from others but prays for God's shining favor, which brings greater joy than material abundance.

outline.heading: Confidence in God's Protection
outline.description: David expresses peaceful confidence in God’s protection, enabling him to lie down and sleep safely without fear.

application: In times of distress, believers should call earnestly on God, trusting in His righteousness and mercy.
Christians are called to live holy lives, avoiding sin and reflecting quietly on their hearts before God.
Trusting God’s favor brings true joy that surpasses material blessings and worldly success.
Resting in God’s protection allows believers to experience peace and confidence even amid trials.

keyVerses.text: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness: thou hast enlarged me when I was in distress; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.
keyVerses.significance: This verse sets the tone of the psalm as a confident prayer for God's mercy and deliverance based on His righteousness.

keyVerses.text: Stand in awe, and sin not: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.
keyVerses.significance: It calls believers to reverence God, resist sin, and engage in personal reflection and stillness before Him.

keyVerses.text: Thou hast put gladness in my heart, more than in the time that their corn and their wine increased.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights that true joy comes from God’s favor, surpassing even the greatest material prosperity.

keyVerses.text: I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep: for thou, LORD, only makest me dwell in safety.
keyVerses.significance: It expresses the peace and security that come from trusting in God’s protection, enabling restful sleep.
